AD_HistoryCheck.speaker: Player
AD_HistoryCheck.text: Pickets, ballistas, siege engines... a little old-fashioned, too. A hundred years? More?

session_synopses.AD_HistoryCheck: Player comments on old siege equiment in SCL

PAD_FlowersAtHouse.speaker: Player
PAD_FlowersAtHouse.text: Flowers blooming in shadow. This is the sign Halsin mentioned.

AD_AfterHideAndSeek.speaker: Oliver
AD_AfterHideAndSeek.text: You were good. But just you wait - I'll get better.
AD_AfterHideAndSeek.context: NodeContext: A little miffed at losing/considering ways to improve his hide & seek game

AD_Dome50PercentHP.speaker: Oliver
AD_Dome50PercentHP.text: You're spoiling my fun! Stop it right now, or you'll be sorry!
AD_Dome50PercentHP.context: NodeContext: Angry (player is attacking a magic dome shielding Oliver, reducing its integrity by 50%)

AD_FriendsSummoned.speaker: Oliver
AD_FriendsSummoned.text: I'll make my own fun if I have to - and my own friends.

session_synopses.PAD_FlowersAtHouse: PAD commenting on the unusual fact that flowers are growing around Olver's House despite it being in the Shadowcurse.
session_synopses.AD_AfterHideAndSeek: After playing with Oliver hide and seek for two times he will stay at his house. Depending on how the player did, he'll be left thinking about new ideas on how to improve his hide and seek abilities or happy because they didn't find him without alerting/killing the shadows.
session_synopses.AD_Dome50PercentHP: This AD happens when you damage nightdome and bring it below 50%.
session_synopses.AD_FriendsSummoned: Spoken by Oliver as he summons more creatures to his defence while the player tries to seize him.

PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.text: Dark Justiciars fell here. Those signs we saw before were no coincidence - they led us here.
PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.context: NodeContext: Captivated. Arc: SH is loyal to shar. Starting to vocalise a sneaking suspicion that this temple is a legendary Sharran site, before dismissing the thought.

session_synopses.PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains: Shadowheart finds the remains of the Dark Justiciars and based on her level of knowledge will make a comment. All of them meant to build up anticipation for the Shar Temple. Can be triggered multiple times.

PAD_HideAndSeek.speaker: Player
PAD_HideAndSeek.text: Where'd that child go? Or... whatever it is.
PAD_HideAndSeek.context: NodeContext: Stumped, looking for Oliver Found Oliver (a little shadow/phantom boy they're playing hide and seek with)

AD_CreepyNoises001.speaker: Object
AD_CreepyNoises001.text: She was no fun. All I wanted was to play.
AD_CreepyNoises001.context: NodeContext: Disappointed. Referring to a dead githyanki the player comes across.

AD_OliverDeathScream.speaker: Oliver
AD_OliverDeathScream.text: Mummy! Daddy! Betsy! No - don't leave me!

session_synopses.PAD_HideAndSeek: AD played when the player finds or fails to find Oliver during hide & seek.
session_synopses.AD_CreepyNoises001: The player hears creepy noises on the path to the house haunted by a shadow family.
session_synopses.AD_OliverDeathScream: Death-scream of Oliver in the Oliver's Diary booster.

000_AD_DriderDropsLantern.speaker: Harper Lassandra
000_AD_DriderDropsLantern.text: The lantern's down - we need to get it!

000_AD_DriderDies.speaker: Harper Lassandra
000_AD_DriderDies.text: Got him! Now to get the lantern.

session_synopses.000_AD_DriderDropsLantern: Drider drops lantern (either being disarmed or killed)
session_synopses.000_AD_DriderDies: Drider dies with Harper Lassandra present

node_data.text: You look like you want to say the magic words. Like they're right on the tip of your lips...
Don't you snurl at me, you nasty cow!

session_synopses: When you ring the pixie's bell, she poofs into existence and asks you aobut some 'magic words'. Depending on how you respond, she'll give a curse or a blessing

HalfOrcCaster_AD_DriderDies.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_AD_DriderDies.text: Our guide is dead - and so are we if they take the lantern!

GoblinMelee_000_AD_DriderDies.speaker: Brawler Vez
GoblinMelee_000_AD_DriderDies.text: The boss is down! Don't let 'em get away with the light!
GoblinMelee_000_AD_DriderDies.context: InternalNodeContext: 'the boss'= the drider (male). 'em = the Harpers (mixed genders)

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: Hold there! One step closer and -

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: True Soul - forgive me, I did not see you in the dark.

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: What - you'll die for this, traitor!
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.context: NodeContext: Half orc Realising the person they thought was an ally is about to attack

PAD_FindAnimal.speaker: Player
PAD_FindAnimal.text: The animal never had a chance. The curse consumes everything it touches.

session_synopses.PAD_FindAnimal: The party encounters a dead Shadow Cursed animal and comment on how the Shadow Curse consumes everything

Harper_Melee_000_AD_DriderDies.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_DriderDies.text: Big and ugly's down - grab the lantern!

Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster.text: You will die here - the Absolute wills it so!

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: And what of the strange little turncoat, Majesty? Should we spare them?

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: *Your minds connect and you hear a whispered voice. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the dark?*

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: A True Soul. Why would one of our queen's blessed walk with Harpers?

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: I infiltrated their ranks - gathering information for our cause.

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: Very well. We welcome all who follow our holy queen.

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: Are they ready to depart? We do not want to linger in the shadows, Majesty.

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: Follow close - the shadows are hungry. Do not stray from the light.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts lantern and illuminates their face.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.text: Incredible. A light that chases away even the deepest shadows.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in player's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Player stows the lantern.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.text: A face I once trusted, now allied with the shadows' most favoured.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext:  Addressed to player. Harper raises bow and points at the player.NodeContext: Very suspicious

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.text: I meant to infiltrate the cult. You've ruined the mission.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.text: Apologies - I had no word of this mission. Take comfort in knowing there will many more yet.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers bow while speaking.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.text: Here - Jaheira insists you take the lantern. It will guide you safely to Moonrise Towers.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper hands player the Moonlantern

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.text: But it will not slay the creatures that emerge from the darkness. Be vigilant 'til the last.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.text: Stay on your toes - more cultists might still pass.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.text: Then we'll gut them like the rest.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.text: We shouldn't hang about. Jaheira's lost too many as it is.

AD_HarpersReachAmbushHouse.text: Perfect spot for an ambush. Get into position.

Harper_Melee_000_AD_LassandraDies.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_LassandraDies.context: NodeContext: Just watched your friend Lassandra die in combat

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush.text: Step into the light! Let us see you.

PlayersAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player moves into the light. Player's positioning should match N218 so it merges into the rest of the dialog flow

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Narrator
PlayersAmbush.text: *Your minds connect and you hear a voice whispering to you. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the darkness?*

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush.text: One of your True Souls, my Queen! How have they survived?
PlayersAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scuttles forward, holding the lantern to illuminate the player's face

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush.text: You blessed them too, my Queen? Where is their lantern?

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush.text: Lantern? Is that what protects you out here?

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush.text: Our goddess protects us. We carry her sacred light to drive back the shadows.
PlayersAmbush.context: NodeContext: 'Sacred light' referring to the Moonlantern

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush.text: Yes, majesty, your light can shield another of your faithful. They will join us on the road.

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush.text: They will follow close. Do not leave the light!
PlayersAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider turns and starts to leave, ready to head into the dark. You're expected to follow.

Caravan_AD_Hyena.speaker: Hyena
Caravan_AD_Hyena.context: NodeContext: Worg pup - sounds like a growl, but actually haltingly articulating a word (they can speak)

Caravan_AD_Hyena.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_AD_Hyena.text: Don't make eyes at me, you breech-blossom.
Caravan_AD_Hyena.context: NodeContext: Colourful goblin equivalent of 'shit-stain'. Said indignantly.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: Heard you're planning to infiltrate Moonrise, and take the fight to Ketheric. That'd be a tale for the ages.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: But the curse is at its strongest between here and there. You won't even reach the tower unless you can survive the darkest shadows.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: There's a cultist convoy that brings supplies and personnel to the tower - by some strange magic, they move through the curse unharmed.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: With your help, we'll ambush them, and seize their secret. When we do, it's yours, and the path to Moonrise will be open.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: All right. But hurry it along, yeah?

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: Your worshippers, Majesty. What happened here?
CaravanStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider arrives to find the camp deserted apart from you and some dead goblins.InternalNodeContext: Drider arrives to find the camp has been slaughteredNodeContext: Looking around at dead goblins - his allies have been slaughtered

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns and looks at the player with malevolenceNodeContext: Turns and looks at the player with malevolence

CaravanStart.speaker: Player
CaravanStart.text: I just found them like this.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: At least these have survived. At least we return with some faithful.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: But we should depart. Are they ready to leave?
CaravanStart.context: NodeContext: Looks out to the dark, then back to players

CaravanStart.speaker: Lae'zel
CaravanStart.text: Every step into the darkness leads us away from the crche. Cleansing awaits - do not lose sight of our prize.

CaravanStart.speaker: Player
CaravanStart.text: First tell me how you can move safely through the darkness.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: We walk in the Absolute's light. Her blessed power keeps the shadows back.
CaravanStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider stares at the moon lantern while delivering line.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: But the shadows are cunning. Wily. If you stray from the light even for a moment, they'll have you.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: Listen - if you want to reach Moonrise, you're going to need help. And I know where you'll find it.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: There's a cultist convoy that passes each day. It carries a lantern that burns the curse away.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: You're going to seize that lantern - and I'm going to help you. Just say the word.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: Fair enough. But try not to dally - that lantern's your key to survival.

AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush.text: All right. You ready for this?

CINE_CaravanIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player pauses as they hear nearby footfalls. They crouch down and observe.

CINE_CaravanIntro.speaker: Kar'niss
CINE_CaravanIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player observes as the drider caravan moves into frame (wide shot).NodeContext: Urging the caravan along.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts lantern and illuminates their face.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in player's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Player stows the lantern.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: You. Don't move a godsdamned muscle.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: Talk. Why in the hells would a cultist turn on their kind?

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: *The pin the man wears is familiar to you. He belongs to the Harpers, a covert organisation dedicated to freedom and balance.*
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the Harper's garb. We see a Harper pin on their chest.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: I'm not one of them. They took me prisoner.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: A prisoner? Then I must be a welcome sight indeed.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: Follow me. I know a refuge from the darkness. You can rest there.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: I will make my way there in my own time.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: A dangerous choice - but yours to make. I will mark your map.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: But don't linger for long. The shadows are not known to take pity.

WaitingDuringEscort.speaker: Kar'niss
WaitingDuringEscort.text: Do not stray from the light, little one. The shadows are hungry.
WaitingDuringEscort.context: NodeContext: panicking a little, twitchy. Stopped momentarily in a dangerous region

WaitingDuringEscort.speaker: Kar'niss
WaitingDuringEscort.text: We must reach Moonrise - She waits there for us. Hurry, hurry, and be done with the darkness.
WaitingDuringEscort.context: NodeContext: concerned, anxious. 'She' is his god

Harper_Melee_000_AD_TakesMoonlantern.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_TakesMoonlantern.text: I have the lantern! Let's finish this up and go home.

AtTower.speaker: Kar'niss
AtTower.text: An interloper receives the Majesty's blessing before us?
AtTower.context: NodeContext: Looking at us with barely-reined in disgust - he is more deserving thatn we are, surely

AtTower.speaker: Kar'niss
AtTower.context: NodeContext: Leaning forward with glint of madness - could be take as encouragement or threat

AD_Harper_Melee_000.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harper_Melee_000.text: I fear neither shadow nor death.
AD_Harper_Melee_000.context: NodeContext: during combat, like a prayer, reassuring self

HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.text: Splendid show - newsworthy, even! Where's Volo Geddarm when you need him?

HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.text: Go on, check the drider. The lantern's yours for the taking.

Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower.speaker: Bedi
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower.text: Her cathedral will stand in the city, True Soul. On the bones of all Baldurians.
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower.context: NodeContext: grave, taking himself too seriously

Caravan_HalfOrcMelee.speaker: Bedi
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee.text: Stay sharp. These shadows can sneak up on you.

AD_CombatStarts.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_CombatStarts.text: Drive them into the dark! Do not let them take our light!

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.speaker: Player
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.text: Looks like the drider's caravan came from here.

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.speaker: Player
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.text: Cages, shackles... all prepared to march captives off to their fate.

AD_Harper_Caster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harper_Caster_000.context: NodeContext: wary but energetic, in combat

Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower.text: No food waiting for us? 'S barbaric. They got plenty of prisoners for the roasting.
Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower.context: NodeContext: whining - end of a long shift and they haven't been fed

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: You mean to reach Moonrise. And I've orders to help you.

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: The path to the Towers is drenched in blackness so deep, even a torch cannot quell it.

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: Yet the cultists have found a way to move freely. Whatever this method, you must claim it.

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: A cultist convoy crosses the land as we speak. I've readied an ambush. Say the word, and we fly.

AD_EscortInterrupted.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_EscortInterrupted.text: Return to the light! Do not stray!
AD_EscortInterrupted.context: NodeContext: Drider notices the player has left the safety of the caravan and wandered off into dangerous ground

Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_AtTower.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_AtTower.text: Wish we was assigned to the war camp. Beer's surely better down there.

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.text: Haven't we waited long enough, Bran?

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.text: We'll wait as long as it takes.

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.text: As long as it takes for what?

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.text: For the winds to blow in our favour.

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.text: Ain't you worried about the shadows?

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.text: Nope. 'Cause I ain't a little coward.

Dead.speaker: Kar'niss
Dead.text: Shepherding... the faithful... carrying... our Lady's light...

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower.text: Absolute's blessing on ya. Maybe Her design will throw us together again sometime.

AD_KillsSomeone.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_KillsSomeone.text: For the Absolute! For my queen!

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower.text: It was an honour to walk the shadows at your side. A little more inviting here though, eh?
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower.context: NodeContext: formal, making a slight joke at the end

AD_Harper_Ranger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_Harper_Ranger_000.context: NodeContext: in combat, menacing your enemies

AD_Warning.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_Warning.text: If they wander, we will not be responsible.

AD_Warning.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_Warning.text: If they die, it is their own fault.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.context: NodeContext: Bows their head slightly. This is their first time meeting a revered true soul

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.text: True Souls don't answer stupid questions.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.text: Forgive me True Soul, we are simply eager to reach Moonrise as soon as we can.

AD_AfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_AfterAmbush.text: Shadows and heretics, Majesty. But they won't stop us. They can't stop us.
AD_AfterAmbush.context: NodeContext: Outburst - a little crazed as a whispering he's been hearing picks up again

AD_PlayerTakesMoonlantern.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_PlayerTakesMoonlantern.text: Return the lantern! You are not worthy to hold her light!

AD_ArriveToTollHouse.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.text: Stay close. The shadows are darkest here - hungriest here.
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.context: NodeContext: Warning the others in your caravan - you're entering a very dangerous area.

AD_ArriveToTollHouse.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.text: Do not stray from the light, no matter what they promise you.
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.context: NodeContext: Warning the others in your caravan - you're entering a very dangerous area.

HarperMelee_000.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000.text: We expect great things of you.

AD_CaravanConflict.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_CaravanConflict.text: You look twitchy, stone-skin. Afraid of the dark?

AD_CaravanConflict.speaker: Kansif
AD_CaravanConflict.text: In this place? Only a fool wouldn't be.

Caravan_GoblinRanger.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_GoblinRanger.text: I miss the camp. It's too quiet out here.

AD_AfterTollhouse.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_AfterTollhouse.text: There's the tower now, big lad. Your breeches still clean?
AD_AfterTollhouse.context: NodeContext: talking to a half-orc fellow-cultist, not to player

AD_AfterTollhouse.speaker: Kansif
AD_AfterTollhouse.text: My blade is. But that can change - just keep talking.
AD_AfterTollhouse.context: NodeContext: talking to a goblin who disrespected you, but it's a mostly-friendly rivalry

AD_AfterTollhouse.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_AfterTollhouse.text: They will be silent! They approach your sanctuary, Majesty.
AD_AfterTollhouse.context: NodeContext: 'they' are cultists he's leading, slightly crazed, talking to his 'god'

Caravan_GoblinMelee_000.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_GoblinMelee_000.text: Can we get movin'? Nabbed these boots from a gnome, and they don't bloody fit.

AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush.context: NodeContext: Very tense, but not shouting. Close to a loud whisper.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The hunter holds the lantern aloft. Its glow warms you through, chasing away the shadows in and around you.*

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in Harper's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Harper stows the lantern.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The Harper demands an explanation. Why did you travel with cultists?*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.NodeContext: Very suspicious

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: I meant to infiltrate the cult. You've ruined the mission.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The Harper sees through your lies and readies for battle.*

HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush.text: Not the cleanest of victories. But a victory, just the same.

HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush.text: Hold your nose and check that corpse. The lantern should still be on it.

AD_TollhouseFight.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_TollhouseFight.text: Pay no heed - onwards, to Moonrise!

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000.text: I must be brief: if you intend to reach Moonrise, no torch nor blessing will fully guard you.

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000.text: Yet I know what can - a strange lantern, used by a cultist convoy that oft passes.

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000.text: Together, we will take it by force - you simply need speak the word.

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_000.text: Let's take on that convoy. You lead, I follow.

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000.text: Quickly, then. I will mark your map, should we be separated.

AD_BeforeAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_BeforeAmbush.text: They must keep up. The shadows are hungry.

AD_BeforeAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_BeforeAmbush.text: ...Patience, Majesty. You bless us with patience.
AD_BeforeAmbush.context: NodeContext: Taking a breath to stop from lashing out

Caravan_AD_GoblinMelee_001.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_AD_GoblinMelee_001.text: I'll gut you in 'er name - for the Absolute!
Caravan_AD_GoblinMelee_001.context: NodeContext: 'er' here being a contraction of "her" (meaning the Absolute)

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint.context: NodeContext: Mumbled. Thought he heard something but quickly dismissed.

session_synopses.Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster: Combat AD for Kanslf, Half Orc caster in the driders caravan
session_synopses.ThanksAfterAmbush: While following the caravan, together with the players are ambushed by a group of players. If they side with the drider after the combat resolves it will thank them.
session_synopses.HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush: Femme Harper Ranger after the fight with the Drider. To ppath: You started the fight with the drider, but switched sides. If you don't give the Harpers the moonlantern they came for, you will need to fight them for it.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersAfterAmbush: Harpers are at the rendezvous point after the ambush reflecting about it.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersReachAmbushHouse: AD that triggers as harpers reach the house from which they will ambush the caravan.
session_synopses.Harper_Melee_000_AD_LassandraDies: Lassandra dies in combat with the drider. Branthos (also in combat with the drider) reacts.
session_synopses.PlayersAmbush: The players have agreed to help the Harpers ambush a caravan of Absolute cultists and prisoners. You've just arrived at the ambush site - the mood is tense, words are spoken in harsh whispers. When the Caravan arrives there's a monsterous drider at its head, muttering to itself, talking to an imaginary queen/majesty that represents the voice of his God, The Absolute. The player can try to trick the drider into handing over its magic lantern (the Moonlantern - a glowing lantern hanging from the end of a staff), although that could leave the drider exposed to the worst effects of the curse. Will likely end in combat, either because you signaled the Harpers to spring their ambush or because the drider got suspicious and attacked.
session_synopses.Caravan_AD_Hyena: A playful, tame hyena is hanging around a goblin guard named Grim. Grim's having none of it.
session_synopses.HarperCaster_000: A Harper, getting ready for a mission that will see them trying to kill a drider - a big, dangerous monster. Main path only available when group dialogue is unavailable. This Harper is boisterous and eager.
session_synopses.CaravanStart: Dialog featuring a goblin and half-orc. Triggers the start of the caravan escort with the Drider appearing.The Drider is male, half-drow elf and half spider (bottom half). He carries a magical lantern to ward off the shadows
session_synopses.HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush: A Harper scout, getting ready to go back out into the cursed land that recently killed her friend. She's preparing to ambush a drider - a big, dangerous target. Her mood is somewhat grim.
session_synopses.AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush: Harper is waiting for the caravan at the ambush spot. After it the ambush starts and the caravan appears.Whispered and urgent - you're about to ambush someone.
session_synopses.CINE_CaravanIntro: The player spots the drider caravan approaching while exploring SCL (no harpers are present)
session_synopses.HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush: Harper leader after the fight with the Drider. You started the fight on drider's side, but switched and sided with the Harpers. They take the lantern and if you want it, you need to attack them or convince them to give it to you.
session_synopses.WaitingDuringEscort: Players were following the Drider accross the shadowlands but moved too far away from the caravan. The Drider will wait for the player to speak with it again before resuming the movement towards the tower.
session_synopses.Harper_Melee_000_AD_TakesMoonlantern: Harper takes the moolantern from the drider.
session_synopses.AtTower: The Drider stands at the top of Moonrise tower - present just before we get our reward.
session_synopses.HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush: Harper Ranger after the fight with the Drider. You may or may not have started the fight on his side. After the ambush has ended, a prisoner threatens you, telling you to hand over the lantern.
session_synopses.Caravan_AD_HalfOrcAndGoblinAtCheckpoint: AD between the goblin and the half-orc when the entire caravan is at the checkpoint.
session_synopses.Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower: This guard was part of the caravan that brought us to Moonrise. Looking around the tower ruins, unimpressed.
session_synopses.Caravan_HalfOrcMelee: Half-Orc at the edge of the shadow curse. Stoic and focused on the job.
session_synopses.HarpersAndPlayersAmbush: The players have agreed to help the Harpers ambush a caravan of Absolute cultists and prisoners. You've just arrived at the ambush site - the mood is tense, words are spoken in harsh whispers. When the Caravan arrives there's a monsterous drider at its head, muttering to itself, talking to an imaginary queen/majesty that represents the voice of his God, The Absolute. The player can try to trick the drider into handing over its magic lantern (the Moonlantern - a glowing lantern hanging from the end of a staff), although that could leave the drider exposed to the worst effects of the curse. Will likely end in combat, either because you signaled the Harpers to spring their ambush or because the drider got suspicious and attacked.
session_synopses.AD_CombatStarts: Drider screams after being attacked during the ambush.
session_synopses.PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint: Players met the caravan alone or with the harpers and backtracked towards where the caravan was waiting the Drider.
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower: A goblin guard who reached Moonrise Towers with us. Currently idle as they await their new orders.
session_synopses.HarpersAtInn: The players encounter a squad of Harpers at the Last Light Inn who're preparing to set out on a dangerous mission to ambush a drider and some cultists in the shadow-cursed lands. Lassandra, a Harper scout that the player may have helped previously, might be there.
session_synopses.AD_EscortInterrupted: Drider pauses the escort because someone was left behind. Drider's tone is a little sharp - it's his responsibility to make sure the caravan he's escorting gets to its destination safely.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush: A group of Harpers are standing outside an inn They had been preparing a dangerous ambush, but now the leader has another idea. The other Harpers are growing impatient.
session_synopses.Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp: Two of the three goblins discussing at the checkpoint. The tracker is nervous, looking to chat to distract himself. Vez is absolutely uninterested.
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower: The caravan has come to a stop at Moonrise Towers. Gronag is one of the guards idling outside until they're sent back out into the dark.
session_synopses.AD_KillsSomeone: Drider kills someone during the ambush encounter.
session_synopses.Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower: Kansif is now safe inside Moonrise Towers after delivering us there.
session_synopses.AD_Warning: Drider warns players and caravan not to move too far away from the light - otherwise the Moonlantern won't protect them.
session_synopses.Caravan_HalfOrcCaster: Player approaches Kansif (a stoic, honourable male half-orc) and Brawler Vez (a mouthy female goblin) after clearing a checkpoint and entering their camp in the Shadowcurse. They two Absolute cultists assume you're a True Soul sent by Minthara (which may or may not be true) and will ask if you brought the lyre needed to summon their guide through the darkness. If you have, you can play it and the drider will emerge. If you haven't, they can tell you where to find it.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersReachTree: AD that triggers near a tree at the shadowlands.
session_synopses.AD_AfterAmbush: Kicks off conflict between two or more caravan members if they are all alive at the bridge next to the town, after the harpers' ambush.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerTakesMoonlantern: Player takes the moonlantern and wasn't on the drider's side.
session_synopses.AD_ArriveToTollHouse: Drider arrives to the toll house and tells everyone to stay close to him.
session_synopses.HarperMelee_000: Harper one-line, with faith that the player will guide them to victory against the big bad Ketheric Thorm.
session_synopses.AD_CaravanConflict: Kicks off conflict between two or more caravan members if they are all alive at the bridge next to the town, after the harpers' ambush.
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinRanger: Goblin at the edge of the shadow curse. Misses the party back at the camp - this place is unsettling.
session_synopses.AD_AfterTollhouse: Kicks off conflict between two or more caravan members if they are all alive at the bridge next to the town, after the harpers' ambush.
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinMelee_000: If the player has been allowed entry to the camp, they can talk to this goblin to learn that they are waiting for a harp from Minthara with which to summon a guide that will protect them from the shadow curse on the path to Moonrise and if they haven't got it, they need to get it from Minthara. If the player has killed Minthara and hasn't already told the checkpoint goblin, they can mention it here.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush: AD as a group of Harpers move through the shadow curse. They're moving at a quick pace, trying to speak quietly. The mood is tense.
session_synopses.HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush: Narrator nodes for the after ambush. Dialgo shared between Elindale, Manus and Lassandra.
session_synopses.HarperCaster_000_AfterAmbush: Harper Caster after the fight with the Drider. You probably started the fight and switched sides to harpers. If so, you need to let them have the moonlantern or fight to keep it.
session_synopses.AD_TollhouseFight: Drider sees any of the tollhouse collector booster NPCs in combat while traversing the tollhouse in TWN.
session_synopses.HarperRanger_000: A Harper, proposing a mission that will see them trying to kill a drider.
session_synopses.AD_BeforeAmbush: Second caravan AD between the bridge and the ambush.
session_synopses.Caravan_AD_GoblinMelee_001: One line combat AD for Warrior Gronag in the Drider Caravan
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint: Goblin at the checkpoint on the lookout for intruders while waiting for the drider.

StayInSCL.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
StayInSCL.text: Our enemies lie to the west, in Baldur's Gate. Do you intend to retreat from them?

StayInSCL.speaker: Player
StayInSCL.text: I have unfinished business to attend to before heading to the city.

StayInSCL.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
StayInSCL.text: I do not - I will return to camp and plan for the journey ahead. Find me there when you are ready.

session_synopses.StayInSCL: Minthara tells the player her business is in SCL now and she will not leave.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Good craftsmanship wasted on Selne. Maybe it can be repurposed somehow.
PAD.context: InternalNodeContext: SH picks up a Selne idol. SH is known to be a Shar worshipperNodeContext: Unimpressed

session_synopses.PAD: ShadowHeart reacting on picking up "Selune Idol"Location: SCL -> ShadowlandsShe reacts both when she picks up the idol or when another character does that.

PAD_FoundFootprints.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundFootprints.text: Paw prints? Where do they lead?

session_synopses.PAD_FoundFootprints: This PAD occurs when the player approaches a set of tracks near a ledge. If the player jumps down, they will find a burrow with a ring inside.

PAD_FoundRolan.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRolan.text: Is that Rolan? I thought he had better sense than this.

session_synopses.PAD_FoundRolan: Voice Bark that plays when the party stumbles across Rolan in the Shadowlands, after he leaves the Last Light Inn looking for his siblings.Characters are surprised to find Rolan out here, but worried for his safety.

ShadowMemory4.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory4.text: *You sense a fading echo of the person who once was. A dockhand. He did not ask for this.*

ShadowMemory20.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory20.text: *A distant memory of a man stretching his back with a groan. Another day of hauling masonry blocks done...*

ShadowMemory8.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory8.text: *She was a healer, trying to aid the wounded in the battle against the Sharrans. But there were so many...*

ShadowMemory16.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory16.text: *You sense a matriarch's flush of pride - she will soon be a grandmother, and the child will bear her name. Muldred.*

Entrance_Plaque3.speaker: Narrator
Entrance_Plaque3.text: *We offer ourselves to the darkness, that blessed Shar may give us her mercy.*

ShadowMemory17.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory17.text: *Callused hands work a hammer and chisel around a massive slab of rock. Months from now, a face will take shape.*

ShadowMemory9.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory9.text: *You see a man stalking slowly through the woods, bow half-drawn. If he bags a deer, the whole family will be kept fed all winter...*

ShadowMemory21.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory21.text: *You can almost taste the sour ale that once clung to this soul's breath. He was insensible when the shadows came for him.*

ShadowMemory5.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory5.text: *You glimpse a young Harper on the eve of battle against Thorm, long ago. He and his comrades toast each other in Last Light...*

ShadowMemory10.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory10.text: *In her former life, this girl played in the nearby woods. She was always the best at climbing trees.*

ShadowMemory2.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory2.text: *You can almost feel the heat from the forge. This one was once a blacksmith.*

ShadowMemory26.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory26.text: *You sense a faded memory of marching in an army against Ketheric Thorm. Victory seemed possible then.*

ShadowMemory30.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory30.text: *An echo of the past shows a man hunched over a ledger, quill in hand. Tolls collected on the Risen Road, destined for Moonrise.*

ShadowMemory31.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory31.text: *You see a man drain his tankard in an inn as he listens to a Flaming Fist play the lute. He's better than his uniform might suggest.*

ShadowMemory27.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory27.text: *You can almost smell the hops and barley for yourself. This man's family always complained that his clothing reeked after work at the brewery.*

ShadowMemory3.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory3.text: *Desperate prayers to Selne, echoing from the past. They did not save him.*

ShadowMemory11.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory11.text: *You see an older woman, on her knees, scrubbing the floor of an inn. The patrons made a mess of things again the night before.*

ShadowMemory28.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory28.text: *You hear the heavy thud of a butcher's cleaver on his block, as he divides his meagre fare for those waiting. Never enough to go around.*

ShadowMemory12.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory12.text: *He had dreams of boarding a ship in Baldur's Gate, and seeing the world. But then the darkness came.*

ShadowMemory32.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory32.text: *An older man turns his head away in shame. His neighbours would not renounce Selne - now they hang in the town square.*

ShadowMemory24.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory24.text: *A strange feeling of resentment comes to you. A travelling merchant, sick of this route. Sick of the tolls eating away his profits.*

ShadowMemory1.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory1.text: *A faded memory of a boy and girl sharing their first kiss. Your own heart almost flutters in tune with theirs.*

ShadowMemory25.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory25.text: *You see an old boot, balanced upside down on a cobbler's knee, as he taps the final nail into the new sole. Good as new.*

ShadowMemory33.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory33.text: *You feel a rush of outrage. This woman worshipped Shar to the end - so why does the Nightsinger's curse not spare her...?*

ShadowMemory13.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory13.text: *You sense a young woman, gazing at Moonrise Towers in awe. Perhaps one day she will get to gaze out from atop it, she hopes.*

ShadowMemory18.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory18.text: *You sense this one hid for days as the sounds of battle got closer and closer to town. You didn't even care who won, so long as it ended.*

Entrance_Plaque2.speaker: Narrator
Entrance_Plaque2.text: *We offer our pain to the Lady of Loss, that she may truly know her faithful.*

ShadowMemory15.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory15.text: *You sense a swell of grief. Before the shadows took her, this woman mourned someone lost in battle.*

ShadowMemory7.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory7.text: *You sense that this one was once a fisherman, taught by his father.*

session_synopses.ShadowMemory4: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory20: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory8: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory16: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.Entrance_Plaque3: Vertical clickable scripture/plaque in the exit/enrance to the Underdark near the Elevator
session_synopses.ShadowMemory17: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory9: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory21: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory5: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory10: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory2: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory26: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory30: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory31: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory27: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory3: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory11: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory28: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory12: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory32: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory24: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory1: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory25: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory33: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory13: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory18: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.Entrance_Plaque2: rounded clickable plaque in the exit/enrance to the Underdark right next to the Elevator
session_synopses.ShadowMemory15: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.
session_synopses.ShadowMemory7: Narrator - echo of the former life of a shadow creature that died in combat. Ghostly impression of the person they once were.

PAD_CurseRemovedByLight.speaker: Player
PAD_CurseRemovedByLight.text: That light - it's protecting me from the curse.

PAD_AfterCutscene.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterCutscene.text: I've never seen darkness like this before. It's unsettling.

PAD_AfterCutscene.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterCutscene.text: But if this is the way to Moonrise Towers, then this is the only path I've got.

DaisyAD_ReachTowers.text: We are approaching the Absolute. A telepathic storm is surging all around us.
And the eye of the storm lies above that tower.

AD_Sign.speaker: Narrator
AD_Sign.text: *Night and shadow have claimed this place. Turn back.*

session_synopses.PAD_CurseRemovedByLight: Curse is removed from player because they are close to a light.
session_synopses.PAD_AfterCutscene: PAD for party banter when players enter SCL, after the cutscene (either SCL_EntryPoint_Mountain.lsj or SCL_EntryPoint_Underdark.lsj, depending on which entrance is used). Lines are generic enough about the shadow curse/look of the land that they work for both entrances to SCL. Two lines from one companion if only one companion present.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_ReachTowers: DaisyAD that plays on entering SCL from either entry point.
session_synopses.AD_Sign: Sign on the Risen Road before the Shadow Curse

AD_Signpost.speaker: Narrator
AD_Signpost.text: *Last Light Inn, west. Moonrise Towers, southwest.*

PAD_HalsinBridge.speaker: Halsin
PAD_HalsinBridge.text: This town - I remember it too well. Much druid and Harper blood was spilled in taking it... only to lose it again.

session_synopses.AD_Signpost: AD on signpost in the shadow cursed lands. The road is twisted and broken, the sign is leaning at an odd angle, but you can still read that there's an inn to the north and Moonrise towers to the west.
session_synopses.PAD_HalsinBridge: Halsin remembers his previous battle in SCL

AD_Idle.speaker: Raven
AD_Idle.context: NodeContext: this is a raven mimicking human speech (look it up on youtube, it's cool and freaky!). Emotionaless and freaky. A loud bark.

AD_Idle.speaker: He Who Was
AD_Idle.text: No. Not until we've dealt with Madeline.

Raven_AD_Bye.speaker: Raven
Raven_AD_Bye.text: I'd say bye, but you'll be dead soon! Hah!
Raven_AD_Bye.context: NodeContext: cruel and vicious, big laugh at the end

session_synopses.AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat: Combat ADs for the Shadar Kai. Says one line at the start orf each of his turns.
session_synopses.AD_TakingTurn_002_Combat: Combat ADs for the Shadar Kai. Says one line at the start orf each of his turns.
session_synopses.AD_Idle: An idle AD playing from time to time after the ritual. This gives hints that He Who Was and the raven are not actually supposed to be in the shadowlands.
session_synopses.Raven_AD_Bye: A concluding AD by the Raven when players completed the quest, before Raven disappears.

StayInSCL.speaker: Halsin
StayInSCL.text: I cannot venture back with you - now that I am in a position to fight the curse, I must stay here and see it through.
StayInSCL.context: NodeContext: Some urgency. Halsin doesn't want to backtrack to previous regions while he's close to achieving his goals.

StayInSCL.speaker: Player
StayInSCL.text: Have it your way, then. Find somewhere safe to camp and I'll see you when I return.

StayInSCL.speaker: Halsin
StayInSCL.text: Very well. I shall seek out your camp as soon as you find yourself amidst the curse again.

session_synopses.StayInSCL: Halsin tells the player his business is in SCL now and he will not leave.

AD_HarperScout_003_Combat.speaker: Harper Karrow
AD_HarperScout_003_Combat.text: Yonas, no! What are you doing?

BridgePoint_003.speaker: Harper Karrow
BridgePoint_003.text: Made it. Go speak to the boss.

AD_HarperScout_003_WrongWarning.speaker: Harper Karrow
AD_HarperScout_003_WrongWarning.text: You turned around? Last Light's this way.

session_synopses.AD_HarperScout_003_Combat: Combat AD for Harper Karrow in SCL
session_synopses.Dead_HarperScout_000: Speak with dead dialogue with Lassandra, a harper scout. The player can ask her corpse, who she is, what she was doing etc, possibly learning of Last Light, a nearby refuge against shadow curse.
session_synopses.AD_HarperScout_000_LeaveWarning: After saving the Harper Scouts from the Shadow creatures in SCL, the player tries to leave without telling the Harpers they're ready to go.
session_synopses.AD_HarperScout_003_WrongWarning: After saving them from shadow creatures, the Harper Scouts are guiding the player through SCL to Last Light.This AD plays if the player goes in the wrong direction.

PAD_ShadowheartResistant.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartResistant.text: I can feel the shadows' power here... but they don't seem to be harming me?
PAD_ShadowheartResistant.context: NodeContext: Some confusion. She seems to have resistance in a shadow-cursed environment  that's affecting all others.

PAD_LightsSnuffedOut.speaker: Player
PAD_LightsSnuffedOut.text: Hells. Torchlight won't last long here.

session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartResistant: Shadowheart comments on how she is resistant to the first layer of the curse.
session_synopses.PAD_LightsSnuffedOut: You're walking through an area where the shadow curse is strong and your torch gets snuffed out by the curse.

VB_Debilitated.speaker: Player
VB_Debilitated.text: This place... I feel chilled to the marrow.
